In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do this in Julia using DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end
```

In this function, `map` applies a function to each element in the column `:dt`. The function extracts year and month from date time and concatenate them together as an integer.

You can use it like this:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = DateTime[now() + Month(i) for i in 1:3])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `ym` to the dataframe.
